comments.content: As you said, answer A is autobind:True should be the answer?
No, look at url = for A. It uses /split, when it should be /bind like B.

discussion.content:
The answer is B.
Bind is to "Bind a network to a template."
Split is to "Split a combined network into individual networks for each type of device"
Both use POST
Source:
https://developer.cisco.com/meraki/api/#!split-network
https://developer.cisco.com/meraki/api/#!bind-network

I think should be

Traditional networks
closely coupled data and control plane
implements network function on dedicated devices

SDN
centralized management
more granular network security

Traditional networks
closely coupled data and control plane --> control and data planes integrated in the device
implements network function on dedicated devices --> network functions are dedicated on the devices thats why we use cli to configure them

SDN
centralized management --> abstract the control plane into a controller like the cisco DNA or ACI to centrally managed devices with only the data planes in them 
more granular network security --> I think because using in SDN security is placed on endpoints, profiles, contracts etc which is more granular.

Traditional Network:

Implements network functions on dedicated devices
Closely coupled data and control planes
Software-Defined Network:

Centralized management
More granular network security

Wocilon and Dex are both correct. As much as anything, for these questions it's always worth going matching the new stuff with the stuff that sounds good. Cisco almost use these exams to sell stuff as much as anything, so they're not gonna say that traditional networks have more granular network security

Provided answer is correct, think about if you consider some of the others: d['data']['statList'] will give us count, detailssURL, name and status, if you use [0] just after that that will return 4, for the value count, which makes A, C and D incorrect!

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
Drag and drop the characteristics from the left onto the network types on the right.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Answer is D. 0 are needed due they are inside lists.
 d["data"][0]["statusList"][0]["status"]
Answer shoulb be D, because you are querying an item inside a list.

questions.question_text:
FILL BLANK -
Information about a rebooted device needs to be displayed with an ID of 260faff9-2d31-4312-cf96-143b46db0211 using the Cisco SD-WAN vManage
Administration APIs. The API documentation states that deviceId is a required request parameter. Fill in the blank to create the REST call.
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Supposedly deviceId is request body now.
https://developer.cisco.com/docs/sdwan/#!software-maintenance/device-operation
Anyways ?deviceId= looks good
The question is vague because you can use the API to get the root and device certs, but B C and D don't make sense so it's A.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of using the Cisco SD-WAN vManage Certificate Management API?

choices.B: to allocate resources to the certificate server
choices.C: to request a certificate from the certificate server
